column4: HEY im looking for some video support, could anyone help me figure out how to get my integrated video to work on ubuntu
anyone??
lspci will show you
wassup
what is the output of@ lspci | grep -i vga
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation 82845G/GL[Brookdale-G]/GE Chipset Integrated Graphics Device (rev 01)
http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/ubuntu-63/intel-82845g-graphics-controller-352262/
seems to  use the i810 driver
which is installed by default
none of that support page makes any sense to me, im completely new to linux OSs, and im trying to learn but i cant do hardly anything with my screen res so low, is this a complicated problem to fix?
its not an ubuntu problem then is it
have you changed the master / slave jumpers on any of them
if they are PATA you will need one master and one slave on each controller
make sure each has power
try just having one CD drive for now, then add the others in slowly
are they PATA?
then i garuntee they will have a jumper on the back
to set master or slave
on one ribbon you have a master and a slave, if you have 2 masters or 2 slaves on a ribbon they will conflict and you wont see either
come to #ubuntu-offtopic
